707560f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 30th St. E.
707560f-b.text:
First Aoenue, north across East 31st Street as photographed from a point close to 30th Street. The gas station on the left occupies the N. W. corner of 31st Street and is of recent construction. Views 2 and 3 are closer to 31st Street. Tudor City is in the right background. The News Building and the Chrysler
are individually depicted.
Views 1,2: October 13, 1939
View 3: September 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707557f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 30th St. E.
707557f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, south from E. 30th Street, showing in the midround several units of Tellevue Hospital. First in appearance is the unit popularly known as the Morgue. South of same is the Ghapel and other oli portions of this medical center. Beyond appears the frame work of the new Out Jatient Clinic building at 26th Street. Tenemerts seen in the foreground are to be demolished for the purposed Psvchopathic unit. In View Ro. 2 this is accomplished tho excavation has not started.
September 19, 1928.
View 2: April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

711949f-a.title: Manhattan: 30th Street - 1st Avenue
711949f-a.text:
30th Street, north side, east from First Avenue.
September 10,1928.
P. L. Sperr.

711950f-a.title: Manhattan: 30th Street - 1st Avenue
711950f-a.text:
30th Street, south side, east from and including First Avenue.
September 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
